AceForge - macOS Edition
========================

How to Launch AceForge:
-----------------------
There are two ways to launch AceForge:

METHOD 1 (Recommended): Double-click "AceForge.command"
  • This opens a Terminal window showing server logs
  • Keep the Terminal window open while using AceForge
  • Your browser will open automatically when ready
  • To stop: Press Ctrl+C in Terminal or use Exit button in browser

METHOD 2: Run directly from Applications
  • Drag "AceForge.app" to Applications folder
  • Right-click "AceForge.app" and select "Open" (first time only)
  • The app will run in the background
  • Open your browser to: http://127.0.0.1:5056/

Installation:
1. Copy both "AceForge.app" and "AceForge.command" to any location
   (or drag AceForge.app to Applications, keeping AceForge.command nearby)
2. On first launch, macOS may ask for security permission
3. Go to System Preferences > Security & Privacy > General
4. Click "Open Anyway" if prompted

System Requirements:
- macOS 12.0 (Monterey) or later
- Apple Silicon (M1/M2/M3) or Intel Mac with AMD GPU
- 16 GB RAM recommended (32 GB+ for training)
- SSD with 20+ GB free space
- Internet connection for first-time model downloads

First Run:
- AceForge will download AI models (~7-16 GB) on first use
- This may take several minutes depending on your connection
- The Terminal window will show download progress
- Once complete, your browser will open to the AceForge interface

For more information, visit:
https://github.com/audiohacking/AceForge
